36. At the Beautiful Gate, Peter and John healed a man who 
was 
A. lame B.   blind C. deaf D. dumb 
 
37. The people referred to as pillars of the Jerusalem church, 
who gave Barnabas and Paul the right hand of 
fellowship were 
A. Cephas, John and mark 
B. James, john and silas 
C. John, silas and Simon 
D. James, Cephas and john. 
 
38. The condition for justification according to Paul is 
A. merit and favour 
B. possession of spiritual gifts 
C. ability to keep God’s commandments 
D. faith in Christ crucified. 
 
39. On which of the following grounds will faith be null 
and promise void? 
A. Faith is a necessary condition for justification. 
B. Believers saved through grace 
C. Salvation comes through adherence to the 
law. 
D. Justification is by God’s grace 
 
40. According to the Letter of Paul to the Romans, 
Christians are to yield themselves to God as men who 
A. have been raised from death to life 
B. no longer live by the works of law 
C. receive baptism after circumcision 
D. have listened to the gospel of Christ. 
 
41. God sent His Son, Jesus Christ, into the world in the 
likeness of sinful flesh in order 
A. to destroy the law 
B. that the law might be fulfilled 
C. that man may walk in the flesh 
D. to save the righteous 
 
42. “… at the name of Jesus every knee should bow… 
every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord…” 
The statement above demonstrates the Lordship of 
Jesus over 
A. Christians only 
B. non-Christians only 
C. all religious persons 
D. all creation. 
 
43. Paul told the Corinthians that if any one has caused 
pain to the church, he should be 
A. removed from their midst 
B. punished severely 
C. forgiven and comforted 
D. made to confess his sins 
 
44. The greatest spiritual gift to seek 
for is 
A. speaking in tongues 
B. love 
C. healing 
D. working of miracles. 
 
45. One of the civic responsibilities Christians are 
commanded to carry out is 
A. honoring elders in the society 
B. maintaining holiness in life 
C. obedience to lawful authority 
D. observing the law faithfully. 
 
46. In the course of his ministry, Paul worked night and 
day so that 
A. he might not be burden to any one 
B. his followers might eat 
C. he could raise money for the work of the gospel 
D. he could pay the debt he was owing the 
brethren. 
 
47. Those who have fallen asleep before the coming of the 
lord are those 
A. sleeping naturally 
B. dead physically 
C. dead spiritually 
D. who are unfaithful 
 
48. James enjoins Christians to remain impartial by 
A. showing love to all without distinction 
B. loving their neighbours as themselves 
C. treating all brethren equally 
D. giving everyone his due 
 
49. According to James, the man who prays to God and at 
the same time doubts is 
A. ignorant of God’s purpose 
B. disobedient to God 
C. double-minded 
D. deceive by Satan. 
 
50. Peter admonishes Christian that suffering for Christ’s 
sake brings God’s 
A. salvation B. blessing 
C.  love D. righteousness 
 
  CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE 1998  
 
1. God made two great lights to 
A. shine upon the earth 
B. rule the day and the night 
C. demarcate between the day and the night 
D. give light to the world. 
 
2. God commanded the earth to bring forth living creatures 
according to their kinds on the 
A. 3rd day B. 4th day C. 5th day D. 6th day 
3. When God heard the groaning of the people of Israel in 
Egypt, He 
A. got angry with the Pharaoh 
B. sent a warning to the Pharaoh 
C. remembered His covenant with Abraham 
D. plagued the Egyptians with drought. 
 
4. The golden calf which Aaron made for Israel was an 
evidence of. 
A. lack of faith in God
